Notes
Strength
Used for blocking, melee attacks, physical feats, athleticism.
Agility
Used for dodging, ranged attacks, actions involving coordination, skill with your hands/fingers.
Intellect
Used for healing and actions that require thinking and knowledge.
Charisma
Used for interacting with other human beings.
Perception
Ability to sense and notice things in the environment, your reflexes.
Willpower
Resist physical and mental conditions and damage.
Luck
Determines loot and general chance.

Combat Bonuses

Block
Reduce damage of an attack by blocking with an item. Add skill amount to a strength roll. Multiply successes by item's block value.
STR +
Dodge
Avoid attacks on yourself. Add skill amount to an agility roll. Each roll success reduces an attacks success.
AGI +
Melee
Skill with melee weapon attacks. Adds skill amount to a strength roll. Multiply successes by an melee weapon's attack value.
STR +
Ranged
Skill with ranged weapon attacks. Adds skill amount to a strength roll. Multiply successes by an ranged weapon's attack value.
AGI +
Running
Determines how fast you run and if you trip while running.
AGI +
Throwing
Ability to throw an object. Add skill amount to a strength roll.
STR +
Unarmed
Skills with fighting hand to hand and grappling. Add skill amount to a strength roll.
STR +

Skill Bonuses

+
+
+
+
Ability
Level
Lvl 1 -   Active Reload
You can now combine reloading and moving. Reloading no longer ends your attack phase (you can now attack right after reloading).
Lvl 2 -   Hit and Run
You can now combine moving and attacking as a single action with a -4 roll penalty.
Lvl 3 -   Bullet Time
Gain 1 additional action. Gain 5 fatigue.
Lvl 1 -   Counterstrike
Fully dodging a melee attack allows you to make a free attack back.
Lvl 2 -   Doublestrike
Gain +2 bonus rolls to your attacks if you melee attack for all of your main actions.
Lvl 3 -   Dodgestrike
Gain 1 free dodge success for every melee attack success after 5 successes.
Lvl 1 -   Go Team Go!
Spend 1 action to give 2 bonus rolls to adjacent/nearby allies. Increase Fatigue by 10.
Lvl 2 -   If you can't do it!
Spend 1 action to target 1 ally. They gain bonus rolls equal to your Charisma. Increase Fatigue by 5.
Lvl 3 -   Nobody can!
Bonus rolls persist through the end of combat. Rolls do not stack.
Lvl 1 -   Combat Sense
You can use an action at the start of each combat round to sense the lowest health target.
Lvl 2 -   Attack Interpolation
Your Combat Sense action can also sense enemy intents, such as their targets for ranged attacks.
Lvl 3 -   Tactician
At the start of combat, you can re-assign initiative rolls between players.
Lvl 1 -   Memory
You can attempt simple skills that you do not have with a -4 roll penalty. You cannot gain bonus rolls for this attempt.
Lvl 2 -   Knowledge
Spend 5 sanity. Get a helpful tip from the ZM.
Lvl 3 -   Mastery
Gain double XP.
Lvl 1 -   Lead from the front
Adjacent allies take reduced damage equal to your Charisma attribute but cannot reduce an attack's damage below 3.
Lvl 2 -   Inspire
Once per combat, you can spend 5 sanity and 1 action to make all nearby/adjacent players have free rolls for a turn.
Lvl 3 -   Stick to the Plan
At the start of combat, you can declare a plan of action. Players who sick to this plan of action gain +2 bonus rolls.
Lvl 1 -   Re-roll
Three times per game session, you can re-roll a roll. You must accept the results of the second roll and you do not regain any resources back.
Lvl 2 -   Treasure Finder
When you scavenge, roll a luck check. If the result is high enough, you can scavenge again.
Lvl 3 -   Dodging Death
Whenever your health is reduced below 0 next, be reduced to 1 hp instead. If feasible, you will be placed away from any immediate danger. This can only occur once. You can use this effect on other players.
Lvl 1 -   Disabling Strike
Your unarmed attack can lower the results of any rolls your target makes this turn, based on number of successes. Does not stack.
Lvl 2 -   Weakening Strike
Your unarmed attack on a target allows other targets to gain bonus rolls when attacking that same target this turn, based on number of successes. Does not stack.
Lvl 3 -   Lotus Strike
Your unarmed attack on a target can stun the target, preventing any further actions this turn, based on number of successes.
Lvl 1 -   Stay Behind Me
You can take damage directed at adjacent or nearby allies.
Lvl 2 -   Shield Bash
Excess block exceeding an attack can now be dealt as damage.
Lvl 3 -   Turtle Mode
At the start of your turn, you can enter defensive mode. You take half damage but deal half damage.
Lvl 1 -   Aimed Shot
Spend 1 action to gain 4 bonus rolls on your next ranged attack this turn.
Lvl 2 -   Enhanced Aimed Shot
Your Aimed shot now adds 6 bonus rolls. You can now accumulate 2 aimed shots in one turn to apply it to a ranged attack next turn as long as the attack is the first action you take.
Lvl 3 -   Critical Strike
Anytime you have 10 or more successes on a ranged attack, deal double damage.
Lvl 1 -   Here to Listen
You can give your Sanity to others during a short rest. Restore 5 Sanity on Long Rests.
Lvl 2 -   Emotional Intelligence
When you give Sanity, give twice as much as you lose.
Lvl 3 -   Personal Conneciton
Anyone you give Sanity to gains 2 Bonus Rolls until the next short rest. This can only be active on one person at a time.
Lvl 1 -   N Mutation
You cannot gain or level this ability through normal means. You are no longer quite human. There is no longer any limit on your Strength, Agility, and Perception attributes and they cost half XP to increase. Skills cost double XP to increase. Unarmed attacks deal damage equal to your Strength attribute.
Lvl 2 -   ???
????
Lvl 3 -   ???
????

Flaws

?
Bonus Rolls will always be set to -4 in low-light/dark environments.
?
Taking damage or failing an action can cause you to drop your glasses. Bonus rolls are set to -6 when your glasses are dropped.
?
You must take special medicine every day or else reduce your current health by 50%, minimum of 10. Start the game with 3 special medicine.
?
Set your Fatigue Cost to 4.
?
Bad things seem to happen around you.
?
Your character occasionally trips or knocks things over.
?

Equipment

Slots:
Quantity
Melee Attack Damage
Damage for throwing your melee weapon.
Block Multiplier
Durability: Use 1 durability for every attack/block. Item breaks if 0.
/
Ranged Attack Damage
Damage for meleeing with your ranged weapon.
Ammo Type
Ammo. You use 1 ammo for every attack. Must be reloaded if 0.
/
Block Multiplier
Durability. Use 1 durability for every reload and melee/block. Item breaks if 0.
/

Inventory

Max Slots:
Quantity
Melee Attack Damage
Damage for throwing your melee weapon.
Block Multiplier
Durability: Use 1 durability for every attack/block. Item breaks if 0.
/
Ranged Attack Damage
Damage for meleeing with your ranged weapon.

Thrown Weapon Damage
Quantity.
Block Multiplier.
Durability: Use 1 durability for every block. Item breaks if 0.
/
Health
Your character dies when this reaches 0. Lose 1 dice from your Body Pool per 10 health lost.
Max:
Sanity
Your character goes insane when this reaches 0. Lose 1 dice from your Mind Pool per 10 sanity lost.
Max:
Energy
This is the number of dice you roll whenever you make any action. Reduced by 1 for every 10 Fatigue.
Max:
Fatigue
Every 10 points of fatigue reduces Energy by 1. Every action will usually cause you to gain fatigue.
Ammo
Primary
Pistols, Submachine Guns, Rifles
Heavy
Snipers, Shotguns, Magnums
Special
Bows, Crossbows, Grenade Launchers
Roll Options
Roll Type
Active
Free
Bonus Rolls
Fatigue Cost
